results.name: Smallest k > 0 such that nk+1 is a square.
comment: a(n) <= n-2 for n > 2; a(p) = p-2 if p is a prime > 2. [Comment corrected by Floris van Doorn, Jan 31 2009]
a(n) = n - 2 precisely when n > 2 has a primitive root; that is, for 4, and p^k and 2*p^k for p an odd prime and k > 0. [From _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Apr 13 2009]
reference: Dorin Andrica, Vlad Crişan, The smallest nontrivial solution to x^k == 1 (mod n) ..., Amer. Math. Monthly 126 (2019), 173-178.
